title: Russian lawmaker: Reports of 'secret' Putin-Trump meeting 'sick'
content:
A senior Russian lawmaker on Wednesday joined President Trump in dismissing reports of an undisclosed conversation between the U.S. leader and his Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin at a summit of world leaders as “ sick . ”
White House spokesman Sean Spicer confirmed that Trump `` spoke briefly '' with Putin at a dinner at the G-20 summit in Hamburg , Germany , earlier this month , but insisted it was just a normal part of presidential duties and denied news reports surfacing Tuesday that it was a second private meeting between the two .
`` There was no 'second meeting ' between President Trump and President Putin , just a brief conversation at the end of a dinner , '' the White House said in a statement .
`` The insinuation that the White House has tried to 'hide ' a second meeting is false , malicious and absurd , '' the statement said .
Alexei Pushkov , chairman of the information policy at the upper house of Russian parliament , said the reports in multiple U.S. news outlets were of “ a secret conversation that didn ’ t happen . ”
“ They ’ re sick , ” he said , reiterating an earlier remark by Trump .
President Trump on Russia election meddling : Putin told me he did n't do it
Putin says Trump satisfied with denials of Russian involvement in U.S. election
Trump also denounced press accounts of the meeting , tweeting : “ Fake News story of secret dinner with Putin is `` sick . '' All G 20 leaders , and spouses , were invited by the Chancellor of Germany . Press knew ! ”
National Security Council spokesman Michael Anton said the discussion could not be classed as a “ meeting ” or “ pull-aside . ”
“ A conversation over dessert should not be characterized as a meeting , ” he said .
The meeting came after a formal conversation between Trump and Putin in which they discussed Russia 's alleged attempts to influence the 2016 presidential election . In that meeting , which lasted more than two hours , Trump says he questioned Putin about whether he meddled in the presidential election – and Putin denied he was involved .
The U.S. intelligence community has concluded that Putin orchestrated a campaign of cyberattacks and fake news to influence the election in favor of Trump . Multiple congressional committees and a special counsel are investigating Russian interference , as well as possible collusion between Trump associates and Russia .
Multiple news outlets reported Tuesday that a previously undisclosed talk between Trump and Putin lasted up to an hour .
Foreign leaders apparently witnessed the more private conversation , of which there is no public government record , and were taken aback by the two seeming to flaunt a close rapport , according to the New York Times .
`` Pretty much everyone at the dinner thought this was really weird , that here is the president of the United States , who clearly wants to display that he has a better relationship personally with President Putin than any of us , or simply doesn ’ t care , ” Ian Bremmer , president of the Eurasia Group , a Washington-based research and consulting firm , told the Times .
Trump was apparently not joined in the second conversation by his own translator , which The Hill reported is a breach of national security protocol .
The White House said the American translator accompanying Trump spoke Japanese , and so both Trump and Putin used the Russian translator to speak to each other , since the American translator did not speak Russian .
`` It is not merely perfectly normal , it is part of a President 's duties , to interact with world leaders , '' the statement said .
content_original:
Melanie Eversley and Jane Onyanga-Omara

USA TODAY

A senior Russian lawmaker on Wednesday joined President Trump in dismissing reports of an undisclosed conversation between the U.S. leader and his Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin at a summit of world leaders as “sick.”

White House spokesman Sean Spicer confirmed that Trump "spoke briefly" with Putin at a dinner at the G-20 summit in Hamburg, Germany, earlier this month, but insisted it was just a normal part of presidential duties and denied news reports surfacing Tuesday that it was a second private meeting between the two.

"There was no 'second meeting' between President Trump and President Putin, just a brief conversation at the end of a dinner," the White House said in a statement.

"The insinuation that the White House has tried to 'hide' a second meeting is false, malicious and absurd," the statement said.

Alexei Pushkov, chairman of the information policy at the upper house of Russian parliament, said the reports in multiple U.S. news outlets were of “a secret conversation that didn’t happen.”

“They’re sick,” he said, reiterating an earlier remark by Trump.

READ MORE:

Mueller now investigating Donald Trump Jr.'s Russia meeting

President Trump on Russia election meddling: Putin told me he didn't do it

Putin says Trump satisfied with denials of Russian involvement in U.S. election

Trump also denounced press accounts of the meeting, tweeting: “Fake News story of secret dinner with Putin is "sick." All G 20 leaders, and spouses, were invited by the Chancellor of Germany. Press knew!”

National Security Council spokesman Michael Anton said the discussion could not be classed as a “meeting” or “pull-aside.”

“A conversation over dessert should not be characterized as a meeting,” he said.

The meeting came after a formal conversation between Trump and Putin in which they discussed Russia's alleged attempts to influence the 2016 presidential election. In that meeting, which lasted more than two hours, Trump says he questioned Putin about whether he meddled in the presidential election – and Putin denied he was involved.

The U.S. intelligence community has concluded that Putin orchestrated a campaign of cyberattacks and fake news to influence the election in favor of Trump. Multiple congressional committees and a special counsel are investigating Russian interference, as well as possible collusion between Trump associates and Russia.

Multiple news outlets reported Tuesday that a previously undisclosed talk between Trump and Putin lasted up to an hour.

Foreign leaders apparently witnessed the more private conversation, of which there is no public government record, and were taken aback by the two seeming to flaunt a close rapport, according to the New York Times.

"Pretty much everyone at the dinner thought this was really weird, that here is the president of the United States, who clearly wants to display that he has a better relationship personally with President Putin than any of us, or simply doesn’t care,” Ian Bremmer, president of the Eurasia Group, a Washington-based research and consulting firm, told the Times.

Trump was apparently not joined in the second conversation by his own translator, which The Hill reported is a breach of national security protocol.

The White House said the American translator accompanying Trump spoke Japanese, and so both Trump and Putin used the Russian translator to speak to each other, since the American translator did not speak Russian.

"It is not merely perfectly normal, it is part of a President's duties, to interact with world leaders," the statement said.
